comment: It was literally the easiest course ever. Each week, you either do a discussion post or essay, and a quiz every other week with no lockdown browser. Take this class.
very easy class, basically if you just submit something you get a 100% on essays and discussion posts.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Online Savvy

comment: Great proffesor. Meet deadlines and you'll get an easy A.

Read what's expected in the Syllabus. He alternates Discussion entries and Written assignments with Quiz.  If you do the work he'll give you full credit.  I emailed him a few times and he answered fairly promptly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: His online section of POLS 1101 was your run-of-the-mill History course. You alternate between quiz/discussion post and essay assignments each week. He is an easy grader, but the assignments can be time consuming, especially the essays. I would recommend taking!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Highly recommend. No final, 8 tests that are all open-note. Easy grader on essays and discussion posts. Overall great professor and Easy A.

This class was a breeze especially for an online course. Professor Scott is extremely laid back and a quick grader! Assignments arent difficult and if you try you will do perfectly fine. He assigned two modules at a time and gave us near a month to complete. The two modules include a short paper and a quiz and can be done in 30 min. Take this class

It was an online course, so it was very easy. The professor was really understanding. The assignments were weekly discussion forums. Every other week would alternate between quizzes and 2-3 page essays. He would often push back the due dates. Easy filler class!

If he is available, take his class. Hands down one of my best professors. He was very understanding and quick respond to emails. No tests or final just weekly quizzes, discussions, or papers (switched week to week). His material was easy to understand and it didn't feel like I was doing busy work.

If you need this course, take him!!! Do not even hesitate. Professor Scott is not a tough grader by any means but you will be writing short papers every other week. It switches off between discussion posts one week, and the next week is a paper. (min 2 pages double spaced, not that hard). There are quizzes over the material. No exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Accessible outside class
